caption.p: Total annual economic damages of health impacts related to fine and coarse dust exposures. Damages are summed across the following mortality and morbidity endpoints: fine-dust-attributable all-cause mortality and cardiovascular, acute myocardial infarction, and respiratory hospital admissions; and coarse dust-attributable cardiovascular mortality and asthma emergency department visits. The parentheses display the lowest and highest estimates based on the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5 range. See Figure 4 for description of AQ constant and Representative Concentration Pathway (RCP) scenarios.
